# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the Julia code for function `clean_column`:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```
This function takes a string (column name) as input, converts it to lower case and removes leading or trailing spaces. It then replaces any spaces or hyphens with underscores using the `replace` function. The regular expression `r"[\s-]"` matches all white space characters including " " (space), "-", "_". 

You can call this function like below:
```julia
clean_column(" My Column ") # => my_column
```
